data.reasoning: The provided data consists only of the restaurant's contact information and does not include any menu items or customer reviews detailing allergen handling procedures. Therefore, it is impossible to assess specific gluten risks, cross-contamination protocols, or staff knowledge. Thai cuisine inherently carries high risk due to common ingredients like soy sauce (wheat) and cross-contamination potential in woks and deep fryers. The lack of any specific safety or warning indicators results in a neutral baseline risk, but the inherent nature of the cuisine demands high caution (high score).
risk_factors: No menu information available to identify gluten sources (e.g., soy sauce, noodles, flour coatings).
No customer reviews or explicit statements regarding gluten-free training or dedicated preparation areas.
Thai cuisine often uses wheat-containing soy sauce as a standard ingredient.
High likelihood of cross-contact in shared cooking surfaces (woks, fryers).
safe_alternatives: Requires direct inquiry with the restaurant regarding their gluten-free preparation protocols and ingredient sourcing (especially for sauces).
